definitions.definition: A cohesive whole built up of distinct parts.
definitions.example: The birds had built an amazing structure out of sticks and various discarded items.

definitions.definition: The underlying shape of a solid.
definitions.example: He studied the structure of her face.

definitions.definition: The overall form or organization of something.
A set of rules defining behaviour.
definitions.example: For some, the structure of school life was oppressive.

definitions.definition: Several pieces of data treated as a unit.
definitions.example: This structure contains both date and timezone information.

definitions.definition: Underwater terrain or objects (such as a dead tree or a submerged car) that tend to attract fish
definitions.example: There's lots of structure to be fished along the west shore of the lake; the impoundment submerged a town there when it was built.

definitions.definition: A body, such as a political party, with a cohesive purpose or outlook.
definitions.example: The South African leader went off to consult with the structures.

definitions.definition: A set along with a collection of finitary functions and relations.
To give structure to; to arrange.
definitions.example: I'm trying to structure my time better so I'm not always late.
